results.title: Encounter with Saul Alinsky
results.creator_credit: Peter Pearson, John Kemeny, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Challenge for change/Societe nouvelle”.
Part One of this film shows a lively confrontation between Saul Alinsky a professional activist, from the US whose efforts have been directed toward organising the poor, and several members of the Company of Young Canadians. In Part Two some young articulate Indians test their inherently tolerant philosophy against the more pragmatic ideas of Saul Alinsky. Peaceful persuasion is the means by which the Indians hope to bring about change while, contrastingly, Alinsky advocates a more direct development of power.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Pearson, John Kemeny, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Saul Alinsky went to war
results.creator_credit: Peter Pearson, Donald Brittain, John Kemeny, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Challenge for change/Societe nouvelle”.
Saul Alinsky, controversial professional organiser, goes to war against the conditions that keep the poor in poverty. The film shows how he helped Black ghettos in the United States find an effective, non-violent method of fighting for their rights. (Awards: New York; Columbus.)

results.title: Challenge for change
results.creator_credit: Bill Reid and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 102 of Series “Challenge for change/Societe nouvelle”.
‘Challenge for change’ is a community based government program. Its objective is to shed light on social problems through the production of films. What is Challenge for Change? What happens with children from deprived areas when they are given a free hand to make their own films? Who can be a better voice for Indian needs and aspirations than an Indian film crew? How angry are the black people with the way society treats them? How do government representatives react to social change and the role of the Challenge for Change program? Can a film project serve as a cohesive agent and catalyst for change within a community, and at the same time serve as a means of communication with government? What is community organizing? What role can film play in participatory democracy? Does controversy lead to violence? How useful are the films from Challenge for Change going to be? This film has some of the answers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Reid and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Trip to Mexico: an integrated approach
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chalkface”.
An enthusiastic approach to integrated curriculum at Southvale Primary School. A program full of ideas where the subject areas are integrated into a complex unit of work based on a trip to China and Mexico.

results.title: Student participation
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Neville Stanley, Victoria. Ministry of Education and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chalkface”.
A look at various aspects of student participation in a number of different primary schools in Victoria. Covers curriculum decision-making in the classroom, students running school assemblies, writing school rules and regional meetings of school leaders.

description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Chalkface”.
A look at various aspects of student participation in a number of different primary schools in Victoria. Covers curriculum decision-making in the classroom, students running school assemblies, writing school rules and regional meetings of school leaders.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chalkface”.
Chalkface co-editor, Piri White, introduces the work of teachers and students at Richmond Primary School in linking art across the curriculum. The theme of the program is “monsters and things are not always what they seem”

results.title: How do you spell my name in chinese?
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Neville Stanley and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chalkface”.
Piri White, co-editor of “Chalkface” explores a way of introducing a language, in this case Chinese, to a primary school class.
